titleStmt.title: Daniel W. Lindsey, General Orders, No. 5
CWG13994

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

body.p:
1
Head Quarters Kentucky Volunteers
Adjutant General's Office
Frankfort March 25th 1865
General Orders
No 5

A Court of Inquiry is hereby appointed to meet at the Inspector Generals Office, Frankfort on this the 25 day of March 1865 or as soon thereafter as practicable, to investigate the question of responsibility of ordnance and ordnance stores mentioned in a certified invoice signed by Lieut Col. J. J. Craddock as transferred by him to Maj C. W. Quiggens, on the 24' day of August 1864.

The following Officers are hereby appointed and will constitute said Court
Maj. W. H. Hays
Lieut W. E. Cox
Lieut Chas. J. Clarke Judge A & Recorder
The Court will hold its daily sessions without regard to hours.

By order of the Governor
D. W. Lindsey
Adjutant General of Ky
